name: erex
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wer(c0, c1), wi(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c0, universe)))

stmt.origin: ex(wer(c0, c1), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c0, universe))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wer(c0, c1), wi(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c0, universe)))
-| wi(wa(wer(c0, c1), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(c0, universe))

stmt.origin: syl2an(wer(c0, c1), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c0, universe), wss(c0, cxp(c1, c1)), wcel(cxp(c1, c1), universe))

comment: An equivalence relation is a set if its domain is a set. (Contributed by Rodolfo Medina, 15-Oct-2010.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 12-Aug-2015.)
